verses.name: Proverbs 5:1
verses.text: My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:

verses.name: Proverbs 5:2
verses.text: That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:3
verses.text: For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:

verses.name: Proverbs 5:4
verses.text: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:5
verses.text: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:6
verses.text: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:7
verses.text: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:8
verses.text: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:

verses.name: Proverbs 5:9
verses.text: Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:

verses.name: Proverbs 5:10
verses.text: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;

verses.name: Proverbs 5:11
verses.text: And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,

verses.name: Proverbs 5:12
verses.text: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;

verses.name: Proverbs 5:13
verses.text: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!

verses.name: Proverbs 5:14
verses.text: I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:15
verses.text: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:16
verses.text: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:17
verses.text: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:18
verses.text: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:19
verses.text: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:20
verses.text: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

verses.name: Proverbs 5:21
verses.text: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the Lord, and he pondereth all his goings.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:22
verses.text: His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.

verses.name: Proverbs 5:23
verses.text: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
